contextId.information: The words "cry" and "prayer" share similar meanings. Together they emphasize the earnestness of his prayer. AT: "please answer my earnest request." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: listen to the cry and prayer

contextId.information: The phrase "the skies are shut up" means that no rain falls from the sky. AT: "When you do not allow any rain to fall." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: When the skies are shut up and there is no rain

contextId.information: The words "Power" and "might" mean basically the same thing and emphasize the greatness of Yahweh's power. The word "hand" refers to possession. AT: "You possess great power." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: Power and might are in your hand

contextId.information: These two phrases mean basically the same thing. The second intensifies the first. AT: "to completely annihilate them" (UDB). (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: in order to completely kill them and destroy them

contextId.information: These two phrases mean basically the same thing and emphasize the intensity of fear. AT: "to make them very afraid." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: to frighten them and trouble them

contextId.information: The second phrase intensifies the first phrase and emphasizes the earnestness of Manasseh's prayer. AT: "He prayed to God and begged God." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: He prayed to him; and God was begged by him

contextId.information: Together, these two phrases form an idiomatic expression that refers to a person's entire being. AT: "with all his being" or "wholeheartedly." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: with all his heart and all his soul
